reasoning_log.comment: Moving east is a safe choice given the adjacent cells: east, south, and west are free while north is a wall. The goal sensor showing the bearing NE with far strength suggests progressing eastward aligns well with moving closer to the goal without backtracking or collisions.

The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the east at a far distance. The eastern adjacent cell is free, making it a safe move forward toward the goal. Other directions are either blocked by a wall or not aligned with the goal bearing.
All adjacent cells are free, and the goal sensor indicates the goal is bearing east with far strength. Moving east is the safest and most direct action toward the goal to maximize team progress.
The agent is surrounded by a wall to the north and east, and out of bounds to the west. The only free adjacent cell is to the south, so the safest and valid action is to move south to progress.

Moving east is the safest valid option as the north and south cells are walls and the west cell is free but moving east aligns with the goal sensor reading indicating the bearing of the goal is east, so this move maximizes team progress towards the goal.

The goal bearing is NE, and moving North advances closer to that direction. Therefore, moving North is the safest and most goal-oriented move.

The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the east, which is blocked by a wall. Moving east is not possible. Moving north is a free cell and not recently visited, so it maximizes progress while avoiding backtracking and collisions.
